## Advertisement Data Analysis

### What's going on with this data?

You need to change the contents of this Rmd! Replace the R code and markdown give below in this template document.

```{r}

# Load and insert the data

library(tidyverse) 

logged_data <- read_csv("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/e/2PACX-1vQVFD9JTLErVW8qtdhbrqUPIQxR0JzAF2Bl_uXlPo5lGKffOt1knPcUToNhANVel7whb2UNc-9ZlviA/pub?output=csv")

latest_data <- logged_data %>%
  rename(
    observation_time = 2, 
    relevance_rating = 3,  
    ad_format        = 4,
    ad_details       = 5,
    device_platform  = 6
        )

min_relevance  <- min(latest_data$relevance_rating, na.rm = TRUE)
max_relevance  <- max(latest_data$relevance_rating, na.rm = TRUE)
mean_relevance <- mean(latest_data$relevance_rating, na.rm = TRUE)

# Create and print bar charts
bar_chart1 <- latest_data %>%
  separate_rows(ad_format, sep = "," )

bar_chart1 %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_bar(aes(y = ad_format)) +
  labs(title = "Frequency of Ad Formats", x = "Ad Format", y = "Count") 
print(bar_chart1)

bar_chart2 <- latest_data %>%
  separate_rows(device_platform, sep = "," )

bar_chart2 %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_bar(aes(y = device_platform)) +
  labs(title = "Observations by Device/Platform", x = "Device/Platform", y = "Count")

print(bar_chart2)


```
### summary values


The dataset contains r total_obs observations, with a minimum relevance rating of r min_relevance, a maximum relevance rating of r max_relevance, and an average relevance of r round(mean_relevance, 2).
